text:
Kim Kardashian West paid a visit to The Ellen Show in an episode, airing Thursday, which featured a wide-ranging conversation: the reality star discussed a whole bunch of topics, including Caitlyn Jenner’s new book, her children Saint and North, and the details of her October robbery in Paris.

Kardashian West appeared composed and measured throughout the episode, which marks her first television interview since the robbery. She started to cry a few times during the section, likely to get the most traction from the sit-down, in which she talks about the robbery and its aftermath. Kardashian West explained to a sympathetic DeGeneres that she is a “completely different person” following the harrowing incident.

“I know it sounds crazy, but I know that was meant to happen to me,” she said. “I don't want to start crying, but I know it was meant to happen. I feel like I'm such a different person. . . . I really feel like things happen in your life to teach you things. I was definitely materialistic before—not that there's anything bad with having things and working hard to get those things, I'm really proud of everyone around me that's successful—but I'm so happy that my kids get this me, that this is who I am raising my kids.”

Kardashian West also said she does not feel the same need to show her possessions and jewelry on social media. “I just don't care about that stuff anymore. I really don't. I'm not here to show off the way that I used to. It's just not who I am anymore.” She told DeGeneres that she now understands that the thieves had been tracking her for two years, as they were monitoring and aware of her acquisitions and range of possessions, in part due to her social-media posts.

She teared up at the end of the segment, too, when describing her thought process during the robbery itself. “Automatically, your stomach drops. It's a feeling you just can't describe. I said a prayer. I said I know I'm going to heaven, I hope my kids and my husband are O.K.” But now, looking back on it, she does believe it could have been more dire. “It does happen really fast, it was a good seven or eight minutes of torture, but when I look back and I analyze it, it could have been worse. They weren't really aggressive; it could have been way worse, so I don't want to sound like I'm not grateful. I'm out, I'm home, I'm safe. I'm such a better person. Let's move on.”

In addition to sharing charming anecdotes about North and Saint (North’s personality is like Kanye’s, Saint’s is like hers), she also had much to say about Caitlyn Jenner’s new book, The Secrets of Our Lives, which the Kardashian family believes does not portray matriarch Kris Jenner fairly. Kardashian West—who says she hasn’t spoken to Jenner in a few weeks—said she is disappointed in the portrayal.

“My heart breaks for my mom, you know, because I feel like she’s been through so much and [Caitlyn is] promoting this book and she’s saying all these things. I don’t think it’s necessary, and I just feel like it’s unfair, things aren’t truthful.” (The central claim in the book, leveled by Caitlyn, is that Kris was aware Caitlyn identified as a woman before they got married.)

“Kendall and Kylie, that’s their dad, and I think my mom’s been so respectful for so long and always wanting Caitlyn around and always wanting to have a great relationship with Caitlyn,” Kardashian West said. “I feel like it’s taken [Jenner] a really long time to be honest with herself, so I don’t expect her to be honest about my mom now. But it’s just so hurtful. I wish her all the success in the world but not at our expense.”

In the episode of Keeping Up With the Kardashians scheduled to air Sunday, Kim will be seen making one of her first public appearances, in Dubai, following the robbery.
title: Kim Kardashian Says the Paris Robbery Was “Meant to Happen” to Her
